DOC.brief_summary: This study will investigate the effectiveness of fluence rates and treatment times of Corneal Cross Linking other than the original FDA approved protocol of 3mw/cm2.
DOC.brief_title: McNeel Eye Center Corneal Crosslinking Study
DOC.detailed_description: Patient recruitment will include individuals from 18 years to 35 years old with established keratoconus. Transepithelial riboflavin .1% will be applied every three minutes for 30 minutes or until complete corneal penetration is observed. Then the cornea will be irradiated with UV light at fluence rates of 15mw/cm2 for 8 minutes or 30 mw/cm2 for 4 minutes. Post procedural evaluation will take place at day one, day 7 day 30, day 90, day 180 and day 365. Pretreatment keratography will be compared at follow up days beginning on day 30.
DOC.criteria: Males or females between the ages of 15 and 35 with keratoconus diagnosed topographically without other corneal ectatic disease. Prior corneal transplantation, prior corneal refractive surgery.
